snippet: There is plenty of smooching on television but the high-impact kiss that lingers for years in the cultural memory, like the Archie Bunker-Sammy Davis Jr. moment, seems to be extinct.
abstract: Neil Genzlinger laments that the high-impact television kiss, which lingers for years in the cultural memory, seems to have gone extinct; recounts now-legendary kiss on episode of All in the Family on February 19, 1972, when Sammy Davis Jr planted one on Archie Bunker's cheek.
lead_paragraph: There is plenty of smooching on television but the high-impact kiss that lingers for years in the cultural memory, like the Archie Bunker-Sammy Davis Jr. moment, seems to be extinct.

headline.seo: TV Kisses Lose Impact They Had in Sammy Davis Jr.’s Day
